sub_title: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) Consulting | Bringing more heart and well-being to the workplace
summary:
Service-oriented management consultant and entrepreneur with 10+ years of experience successfully building organizations, teams, and programs from the ground up, international insights gained from working on 4 different continents, and business proficiency in 3 languages. 

A calling for advancing well-being, diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging (DEIB), as well as creative employee-centered solutions in the workplace. 

Skilled at articulating visions, managing important relationships, implementing complex projects, and leveraging resources. Adept at supporting startups, nonprofits, governments, large businesses, and international networks. Ability to switch between the big picture and the details and to execute quickly. Strong work ethic. Bring positivity, kindness, and forward energy to teams. 

Areas of Expertise
•	Management Consulting
•	Human Capital Consulting
•	Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB)
•	Organizational Design and Change Management
•	Brand Development
•	Strategic Business Planning	
•	Business & Partnership Development
•	Technology Startups
•	Nonprofit and Government Initiatives
•	International Relations

treasury_media.title: “Pacific Innovation: TUMU, the web platform that wants to unite the Oceanians of the world.”, Outremers 360
treasury_media.description: Toutes deux originaires de Tahiti, c’est néanmoins à l’Université de Stanford que Marushka Hirshon et Matatea Changuy se rencontrent avant, un an plus tard, de préparer le pré-lancement de TUMU depuis le lobby d’un hôtel à Hollywood.

treasury_media.title: S’accepter tel que l’on est, ça ressemble à quoi ? | Matatea CHANGUY | TEDxPapeete
treasury_media.description: Qui n'a jamais eu de blessures étant plus jeune, des complexes, des peurs qui nous suivent tout au long de notre vie ? Certaines ne se voient plus une fois adulte mais elle continue à guider nos pas, consciemment ou inconsciemment. Bien que nous ayons chacun notre histoire, il n'appartient qu'à nous de surmonter nos échecs et de construire notre avenir.

treasury_media.title: “From Tahiti to Space: The woman who wants to find a planet like Earth in the closest Star to the Sun.”, Paula Hernández, Revista M

projects.title: Chile-California Partnership on Climate Change
projects.description: Seeking to reinvigorate and fine tune the collaborative efforts between the Chilean Ministry of Environment and the California Environmental Protection Agency to combat climate change. This projects includes the preparation of Chile's Under Secretary's visit to the Bay Area in November 2014 and the potential signing of a new MoU between both agencies.

projects.title: Inter-municipal Cooperation in Zero Waste Management
projects.description: Designing a collaborative initiative between the municipalities of San Francisco and Peñalolén (Santiago, Chile) in zero waste management, low-income communities empowerment, and green entrepreneurship.

contributors.headline: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) Consulting | Bringing more heart and well-being to the workplace

projects.title: NASA Ames-Chile Partnership in Astrobiology
projects.description: The objective of this project is to establish formal channels of collaboration between NASA and Chilean scientists in the fields of astrobiology and astronomical instrumentation. Such partnership will enable the involvement of Chilean scientists in the creation of cutting-edge technology and significant scientific discoveries, as well as the formation of local experts.

Optical Engineer at NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory

projects.title: Rethinking Urban Planning in Chile From California
projects.description: The CCC seeks to stay at the forefront of trans-diciplinary dialogues and cross-sectors collaboration in urban planning. Part of the work done in the past year covers the planning of a series of conversations on the intersection of urban planning, technology and innovation in the Chilean context, the support of nascent initiatives, as well as the creation of political awareness.

contributors.headline: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) Consulting | Bringing more heart and well-being to the workplace

projects.title: Marine Education and an Aquarium for Chile
projects.description: This project consists in developing a national plan for the education for the conservation of marine ecosystems in Chile. The initiative seeks to promote cultural change on coastal and marine care in Chile, through long term science-based and globally linked educational programs, with public and private partner.

contributors.headline: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) Consulting | Bringing more heart and well-being to the workplace

projects.title: Prácticas para Chile: Formation of Future Public Policy Makers
projects.description: Prácticas para Chile is an international internship program sponsored by the Chilean government through the Ministry of Finance that seeks to offer graduate students from California the opportunity to participate in the creation of public policies in Chile through a three-month internship into one of Chile's Ministries. The CCC also received interns at its offices in San Francisco.

profile_positions.description: Provide management and strategy consulting in service of organizations seeking to transform their culture, improve employee experience and well-being, and build internal capacity to assess and sustain DEI efforts.
profile_positions.title: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Consulting Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
► Helped develop an enterprise diversity and inclusion strategy, successfully positioning the client to create alignment and standardization across the business and influence global affiliates to adopt the same framework.
►  Led governance workstream for a new Chief Diversity Office reporting directly to the CEO, enabling a C-Suite business imperative to become a reality and top executives to deliver against their organizational commitments to over 13,000 workers.
► Provided change management education and support—including change impact assessment, stakeholder assessment, and communication toolkit—enabling client to confidently lead over 3,000 workers through a Workday Financial implementation to streamline their business processes.
► Led events planning for MBA recruiting efforts as the Recruiting Events Lead for one of Deloitte’s target schools, resulting in a 100% offer acceptance rate.
► Successfully sold a $0.5M high-impact diversity and inclusion proposal to one of Deloitte’s top technology partner.
profile_positions.title: Human Capital Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Led all business operations, client interactions and internal creative outputs. Provided 1:1 coaching to professionals seeking to reinvent their careers, start a company or take a bold leap towards something new. 

S2L Consulting - Strategic management consulting for impact-driven organizations.
S2L Coaching - Coaching for entrepreneurs, creatives, and small business owners.
profile_positions.title: Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
Non-profit founded to advance frontier space science and exploration through innovative funding and management approaches where I serve as manager, liaison, and strategist for scientists, partners, board members, consultants, and third-party vendors. 

► Achieved top priority goal of signing of a legal agreement with NASA through sustained milestone attainment in communication, marketing, project management and resource acquisition, resulting in access to NASA personnel.
► Successfully raised over $150k for flagship telescope engineering design via crowdfunding management. 
► Designed statement of work, business plan, revenue model, and pitch deck for client resulting in the launch of a new commercial satellite venture.
profile_positions.title: Management Consultant @The BoldlyGo Institute

profile_positions.description:
Nonprofit to accelerate the study and exploration of Alpha Centauri through the participation of the private sector that I help formed and grow since its inception.

► Directed change management, future-state planning, and organization design during the creation of a global consortium of 4 space science entities, thereby increasing organizational support by 400% and securing $250K of additional project funding.
► Successfully launched a $1M crowdfunding campaign and built a community of 3K followers in support of Project Blue—the search for our nearest Earthlike planet.
profile_positions.title: Operations Consultant @Mission Centaur

profile_positions.description:
The Gump station is UC Berkeley's research station in South Pacific, on the island of Moorea where I acted as a Liaison and Communication Consultant for Gump and its outreach center (Te Pu Atitia) in the US and in French Polynesia in parallel to building institutional and organizational capacity. 

► Championed and led communication strategies between island communities and scientists, resulting in the creation of sustainable knowledge transfer channels between said parties and breakthroughs in biodiversity conservation research.
profile_positions.title: Liaison and Communications Consultant @UC Berkeley Gump Station

profile_positions.description:
Environmental technology company dedicated to building sustainable floating islands where I serve as advisor in the areas of community outreach and partnerships with space innovators.
► Strengthened relationships and built trust with top government officials of multiple countries, which increased the support for Blue Frontiers’ first ocean city pilot in targeted sites. 
 ► Liaised Blue Frontiers with space ventures.
 ► Represented Blue Frontiers in French Polynesia for government meetings and local partnership renewal.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Nonprofit seeking to provide sustainable development solutions for islands. Its mission was to promote energy and resource independence, long-term biodiversity preservation and management, equitable and modern economic models, and developmental and cultural reinvigoration and empowerment. Land Above Water first project focused on the Pacific island of Moorea, French Polynesia.
► Successfully developed in-depth proposal to foster 100% renewable energy in collaboration with local authorities, French energy companies, and the U.C. Berkeley research station.
profile_positions.title: President & Co-founder

profile_positions.location: Bahía de San Francisco y alrededores, Estados Unidos
profile_positions.description:
Initiated by Chile's Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the CCC is a nonprofit dedicated to building strategic partnerships that facilitate the exchange of knowledge and technologies between Chile and California in education, science, sustainability, and entrepreneurship. The CCC is a hybrid foreign policy endeavor infusing actors from the public and private sector in Chile and California into traditional forms of diplomacy. Here, I served as the partnership and funds leader for a leading coalition and liaison with the government of Chile. 

► Operationalized organizational structure through workforce and organizational design strategy (RACI frameworks, metric, and position creation), which increased operational output and secured $250K in government funding.
► Strengthened diplomatic relationships between the governments of Chile and California and increased exchanges between both territories through the development of 12 partnerships across a wide range of fields over 2 years.
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Renewable Energies of Aysén (ENERAYSEN) was established to develop run-of-river hydropower projects in Chile's Region of Aysén, as a low-impact alternative to existing large-scale projects with the objective to meet local energy demand, reduce the cost of electricity, as well as the city of Coyhaique's air contamination levels.
► Developed the startup’s corporate identity and advised on fundraising practices, equipping ENERAYSEN with tools to attract new business opportunities (water rights deal with Energía Austral, a Chilean hydroelectric development company). 
► Led the revision of three 25MW run-off river projects to ensure environmental compliance with water code. Approval was granted by the regional regulatory agency.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
APEMEC is a Chilean nonprofit created to represent and protect the activities of small and medium hydropower plants. APEMEC provides technical and market information to project developers, raise awareness of the obstacles the sector faces and design solutions for them, builds a network of key players, and encourage the creation of incentives and subsidies from the government.
► Designed and executed the EXPO APEMEC 2010—the first international small hydropower fair in Chile (800 participants; Chilean Energy Minister; National Media). Now a yearly conference.
► Created a survey on the national small hydropower potential, empowering APEMEC to better negotiate for the government’s support in removing legal barriers to projects development.
► Recruited foreign industry suppliers to join APEMEC’s network by attending international conferences and networking events, enabling APEMEC to meet local projects’ need for a larger range of suppliers and technologies unavailable locally.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description: Acting as a Mentor for the BST Innovation and Singularity University organized "One Billion Impact Women," a contest aimed at promoting and rewarding women innovators in Chile.

ONESIA - Pacific Storytellers is multimedia platform for stories about the Pacific. This platform connects Polynesian artists, writers, and thinkers to create a collective memory of Oceania and showcase the voices, faces, and stories of its people.
